newsitem.title: USA: Air Products invests $40 mln in Brazilian projects.
newsitem.headline: Air Products invests $40 mln in Brazilian projects.

text.p: Air Products Gases Industriais Ltda., a unit of Air Products and Chemicals Inc said Tuesday it is investing over $40 million in three new industrial gas projects serving the pulp and paper industry and other key market segments in southern Brazil.

These three industrial gas projects are in addition to APGIL's previously announced project to build a new hydrogen and carbon monoxide production facility in the Camacari petrochemical complex in Bahia, which is slated to come on stream during the seond quarter of 1997, said the company.
Air Products and Chemicals is a leading international supplier of industrial gases, specialty and intermediate chemicals, and equipment and services.
